snippet: The lawsuit, filed in circuit court in Jackson County, Mo., is one of the first concussion-related cases against a specific N.F.L. team, and may trigger other suits.
abstract: Five former Kansas City Chiefs players sue team for not warning of long-term dangers of concussions they say they received during playing days; Alexander Cooper, Leonard Griffin, Christopher Martin, Joseph Phillips and Kevin Porter played from 1987 to 1993, when there was no collective bargaining agreement; under Missouri law, former employees can sue in absence of worker's compensation.
lead_paragraph: The lawsuit, filed in circuit court in Jackson County, Mo., is one of the first concussion-related cases against a specific N.F.L. team, and may trigger other suits.

headline.main: Five Former N.F.L. Players Sue the Chiefs Over Head Injuries
headline.print_headline: Five Former Players Sue Chiefs Over Head Injuries
